title: [BUG] Ray Integration Code has a bug

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

labels.name: area/sqlalchemy
labels.description: Use of SQL alchemy in tracking service or model registry

body:
### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.

### MLflow version

1.25.1

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Amazon Linux
- **Python version**: 3.8
- **yarn version, if running the dev UI**:


### Describe the problem

The MLflow Ray Integration Code has a bug.
When using the MLflowLoggerCallback in Ray.tune() method, the whole training process fails an the mlflow callback class thorws an error:

```
File "/home/andriybulezyuk/venv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/utils/rest_utils.py", line 163, in http_request
    raise MlflowException("API request to %s failed with exception %s" % (url, e))
mlflow.exceptions.MlflowException: API request to https://xxx:443/api/2.0/mlflow/runs/log-parameter failed with exception HTTPSConnectionPool(host='xxx, port=443): Max retries exceeded with url: /api/2.0/mlflow/runs/log-parameter (Caused by ResponseError('too many 500 error responses'))
```

I expected the mlflow ray integration to log all the parameters and continue training/tuning the model.

### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

        analysis = tune.run(
            self.TUNE_METHOD_ID,  # e.g. 'PPO'
            config=self.trainer_config,
            loggers=DEFAULT_LOGGERS,
            local_dir=self.LOCAL_RESULT_DIR,
            name=self.name,
            checkpoint_freq=self.checkpoint_freq,
            checkpoint_at_end=True,
            stop=MaximumIterationStopper(max_iter=self.max_iter),
            trial_dirname_creator=self.trial_dirname_creator,
            callbacks=[MLflowLoggerCallbackFixed(
                experiment_name=self.mlflow_experiment_name,
                tags={
                    "config": str(self.trainer_config)
                },
                save_artifact=False)]
            )
        return analysis

### Other info / logs

_No response_

### What component(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [ ] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend
- [X] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

### What interface(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [X] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

### What language(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages

### What integration(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations
- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
